intro: Gilia watsonii, commonly known as Watson's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Gilia watsonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in low-water conditions.
